ProblemWhen you clone a repo to your local machine, it doesn’t pull all the branches to your local. Then you have to manually pull the branches you want.
SolutionTo pull all the branches from the remote, run the following command
git branch -r | grep -v '\->' | sed "s,\x1B\[[0-9;]*[a-zA-Z],,g" | while read remote; do git branch --track "${remote#origin/}" "$remote"; done git fetch --all git pull --all Done!
Resources Stackoverflow solution: https://stackoverflow.
title: No More Manual Pulling: How to Automatically Pull All Git Branches from Remote to Local
